revisions.rev:
{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |Year=2008â09 |Prev year=2007â08 |Next year=2009â10 |Team=Louisville Cardinals |Conference=Big East Conference |Division= |ShortConference=Big East |CoachRank=5 |APRank=1 |Record=31â6 |ConfRecord=16â2 |HeadCoach=[[Rick Pitino]] |AsstCoach1=[[Steve Masiello]] |AsstCoach2=[[Walter McCarty]] |AsstCoach3=[[Richard Pitino]] |StadiumArena=[[Freedom Hall]] |Champion=Big East Regular Season Champions
[[2009 Big East Men's Basketball Tournament|Big East Tournament]] Champions |BowlTourney= [[2009 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA]] |BowlTourneyResult= Regional Final }} {{2008â09 Big East men's basketball standings}} The '''2008â09 Louisville Cardinals men's basketball team''' represented the [[University of Louisville]] in [[basketball]]. The team was coached by [[Rick Pitino]] in his eighth year at the school. Louisville played its home games in [[Freedom Hall]] and was a member of the Big East conference == Preseason == After an elite eight appearance in the [[2008 NCAA men's basketball tournament|2008 tournament]], Louisville entered the 2008â09 season ranked third in both the [[AP Poll|AP]] and [[Coaches Poll|Coaches]] polls in part due to a strong recruiting class. The incoming freshman class is ranked fifth overall by Scouts.com{{cite web |url=http://scouthoops.scout.com/2/701516.html |title=Scout.com 2008 Top 25 Recruiting Classes |accessdate=2008-11-22 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher=}}, led by number one ranked center [[Samardo Samuels]]. Louisville has been picked by many analysts to be a potential Final Four contender, including [[Sports Illustrated]]{{cite news |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2008/basketball/ncaa/11/10/roundtable/index.html |title=SI.com writers discuss SI's official preseason Top 20 |accessdate=2008-11-22 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= November 10, 2008|work= CNN|publisher=}} and [[Dick Vitale]]{{cite web |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/broadband/video/videopage?videoId=3711542 |title=Dick Vitale's Final Four Predictions |accessdate=2008-11-22 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher=}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}. == Regular season == Despite the #3 preseason ranking, Louisville struggled in the non-conference losing to three unranked opponents. After beating [[2008-09 Kentucky Wildcats men's basketball team|Kentucky]] on an [[Edgar Sosa (basketball)|Edgar Sosa]] [[buzzer beater|buzzer-beating]] three pointer{{cite web |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=290040097 |title= Kentucky vs. Louisville â Recap |accessdate=2009-01-17 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher=[[ESPN]]}}, Louisville entered [[Big East]] play ranked #21. After beating [[South Florida Bulls|South Florida]] easily, Louisville beat three straight ranked teams in close games: #17 [[2008â09 Villanova Wildcats men's basketball team|Villanova]]{{cite web |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=290100222 |title=Louisville vs. Villanova â Recap |accessdate=2009-01-17 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher=[[ESPN]]}}, #12 [[2008â09 Notre Dame Fighting Irish men's basketball team|Notre Dame]] in overtime{{cite web |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=290120097 |title=Notre Dame vs. Louisville â Recap |accessdate=2009-01-17 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher=[[ESPN]]}}, and previously unbeaten #1 [[2008â09 Pittsburgh Panthers men's basketball team|Pittsburgh]].{{cite web |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=290170097 |title=Pittsburgh vs. Louisville â Recap |accessdate=2009-01-17 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher=[[ESPN]]}} Louisville would continue strong play, going undefeated in January and winning its first eight conference games before losing to #1 [[Connecticut Huskies men's basketball|Connecticut]] on February 2. After beating St. John's, Louisville lost by their most lopsided margin since joining the Big East, a 33-point drubbing by Notre Dame. After that game, Louisville won its final seven regular season games to win the school's first ever regular season Big East championship. == Big East Tournament == By virtue of their outright regular-season title, Louisville received a double-bye in the [[2009 Big East Men's Basketball Tournament|Big East Tournament]] and played their first game in the tournament quarterfinals. In the tournament, Louisville beat [[2008â09 Providence Friars men's basketball team|Providence]] 73â55 in the quarterfinals and #10 [[2008â09 Villanova Wildcats men's basketball team|Villanova]] 69â55 in the semifinals to advance to the school's first ever Big East Tournament championship game in four seasons in the conference.{{cite web |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=290720097 |title=Villanova vs. Louisville recap |accessdate=2009-03-13 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher=[[ESPN]]}} In the finals, Louisville won its first Big East Tournament Championship, defeating #18 [[2008â09 Syracuse Orange men's basketball team|Syracuse]] 76â66. Due to losses in the early conference tournament rounds by several teams above them, the Cardinals finished #1 in the final regular season AP and coaches' pollsâthe first time in school history they have been ranked #1 in either poll. == NCAA Tournament == Louisville was awarded the top seed in the [[2009 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Tournament]] Midwest Region, as well as the overall #1 seed in the tournament. This is Louisville's second ever 1-seed. The Cardinals beat [[Morehead State Eagles|Morehead St.]] and [[Siena Saints men's basketball|Siena]] in the first two tournament rounds, advancing to face [[Arizona Wildcats men's basketball|Arizona]] in the Sweet 16 on March 27. After beating Arizona by 39 points, Louisville faced [[2008â09 Michigan State Spartans men's basketball team|Michigan St.]] in the Elite Eight and lost 64â52. == Roster == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !
